name: Houghton Mill and Houghton Meadows Walk, Houghton Mill

ai.summary: A scenic 10 km loop starting at Houghton Mill that follows the River Great Ouse through meadows and along quiet riverbanks. The route combines village paths, grassy fields and moderate ups and downs, making it a rewarding walk for most hikers.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat to gently rolling terrain with a mix of surfaced paths, gravel tracks and grassy field edges. Expect some muddy sections after wet weather and a few short stiles or gates. River sections can be exposed to wind and sun.
ai.safety_notes: - Check weather and river levels before setting out. - Wear sturdy waterproof footwear for mud and damp grass. - Stay on marked paths and keep away from river edges, especially with children. - Be mindful of livestock in meadow sections and gates or stiles. - Bring water, a map or phone with offline navigation and a small first aid kit. - Let someone know your plan and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots or shoes with good grip
Light rain cover or packable waterproof
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are ideal for this walk, when meadow flowers and birds are most active. It can be muddy and less pleasant in wet winter weather.

seo.title: Houghton Mill and Houghton Meadows Walk – 10 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a 10 km moderate hike from Houghton Mill along the River Great Ouse through meadows and riverside paths. Practical tips, terrain overview and gear for this UK hike.
